body.p: Sir. Some time in july last there were arrested, in this Hancock County Ky 13 young men citizens of said County who were about leaving for the rebel army. They were arrested by the by the Home Guards taken to Louisville, and from there sent to Camp Morton and are now at Johnson Island one of the member has since died of camp fever. Five of the number viz. Gideon.G. Snider Jesse.C. Morison, Thomas Long, Joe McIntire and John Jenkins are willing to take the oath to support the consitution of the united states, as they write home to their parents and that they were over persuaded to do what they did, also that they are desirous of being good. & loyal citizens. They are willing to give bond with good security for the faithful performance of their loyalty: Their parents are willing to go with them in bond as their security.

We a part of the Home Guards who arrested the young men have every confidence, that if you will have them released, on these condition They will from this time forward make good and loyal citizens, They are all under age inexperienced boys

Minor. E. Bate
N. L. Lightfoot
John. Hale
Post-Master, Hawesville Wm. H. Henry } Homes Guards
Presideing Judges. John McBrown
M. G. Cooper

State of Kentucky
Hancock County } Sct

I, Eldred. E. Pate, now clerk of both courts of the above named county, and at that time ^acting^ colonel of the Home Guards, also made the arrests in person, certify that the ^men whose^ names ^are^ signed above are good and loyal citizens.

Eldred. E. Pate Clerk
Hancock County & circuit C

Hawesville Ky.
Nov. 20"/62
Pate E. E.
Clk Hancock Co Court.
